intro: Scabiosa grandiflora, commonly known as the Greater Scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, hairy stems and serrated leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and wildflower meadows. Scabiosa grandiflora is also valued for its role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
